metadata.Title: CVE-2019-8769 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue existed in the drawing of web page elements. The issue was addressed with improved logic. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.1 and iPadOS 13.1, macOS Catalina 10.15. Visiting a maliciously crafted website may reveal browsing history.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8769` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.26.1-3
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.26.1-3
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.26.1-3
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.26.1-3
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.26.1-3
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.26.1-3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.26.1-3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.26.1-3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.26.1-3
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.26.1-3
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.26.1-3
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.26.1-3
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.26.1-3
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.26.1-3
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.26.1-3').
